revised_title: The Fine Morphology and Function of Osphradial Sense Organs in Mollusca
tldr: This study investigates the fine morphology and function of osphradial sense organs in 50 species of prosobranch gastropods, representing various superfamilies, habits, and environments. The results show that the sensory epithelium of the osphradium reflects environmental conditions, while the ultrastructure of osphradial cell types reflects taxonomic relations. This information can be used to differentiate between taxa and improve our understanding of prosobranch evolution.
